subject: RE: [junit] Websphere Studio Application Developer
msgSnippet: Assuming that you ve done this: 1. download the plugin org.junit  - JUnit 3.7 packaged as an Eclipse plugin. Notice: Since  build 20011218 org.junit is part of
messageBody:
Assuming that you've done this:
1. download the plugin org.junit - JUnit 3.7 packaged as
an Eclipse plugin.
Notice: Since build 20011218 org.junit is part of the
SDK build and doesn't need to be downloaded.

2. download the plugin org.eclipse.jdt.junit - the JUnit
Eclipse plugin.

3. extract the plugins into the plugins directory of your Eclipse install.

To run a unit test single click on it and then go to the run menu dropdown
and select run - run Junit tests".



> Downloaded that already...didn't see how to
> 'integrate' it into the IDE. :(
>
> Still poking around the source code as well...
>
> -Eric
>
> --- "STRAYER, JON (AIT)" <jon.strayer@...> wrote:
> > see http://junit.org/ides.htm#Eclipse

> > have in VAJ work in

> > > it hasn't so far.
> > >
> > > Thanks!!
> > >
> > > -Eric
> >
>
